docs.snippet: A federal immigration raid that took 97 people into custody at a Tennessee meat processing plant may be the biggest employment crackdown under President Donald Trump's administration, civil rights activists said Friday.

headline.main: Immigration Raid Takes 97 Into Custody at Tennessee Plant
headline.print_headline: Immigration Raid Takes 97 Into Custody at Tennessee Plant

docs.snippet: Texas Republican congressman Pete Sessions quietly visited Venezuela this week and met with President Nicolas Maduro at the invitation of the socialist government in a peacebuilding mission that has raised some eyebrows in Washington.

headline.main: Texas Republican Made Secret Peacemaking Trip to Venezuela
headline.print_headline: Texas Republican Made Secret Peacemaking Trip to Venezuela

docs.snippet: The rival Koreas held preparatory talks Thursday for a summit later this month between North Korean leader Kim Jong Un and South Korean President Moon Jae-in amid a global diplomatic push to resolve tensions over the North's nuclear program.

headline.main: Koreas Holds Preparatory Talks to Set Up Kim-Moon Summit
headline.print_headline: Koreas Holds Preparatory Talks to Set Up Kim-Moon Summit

docs.snippet: In attempting to punish China for its trade practices, President Donald Trump may open the door for other countries to grab U.S. market share, including Mexico and Japan, which he has also targeted with sharp trade rhetoric.

headline.main: U.S. Tariffs on China May Simply Widen Door to Other Countries
headline.print_headline: U.S. Tariffs on China May Simply Widen Door to Other Countries

docs.snippet: Turkey, Iran and Russia pledged on Wednesday to accelerate efforts to bring stability to Syria, underlining their joint commitment to the country a day after President Donald Trump raised the prospect of withdrawing U.S. troops.

headline.main: Turkey, Iran, Russia Say Will Work for Stability in Syria
headline.print_headline: Turkey, Iran, Russia Say Will Work for Stability in Syria
